title: rustdoc: Suggest a correct disambiguator if the link is otherwise correct

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-hard
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Hard / a lot

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-intra-doc-links
labels.description: Area: Intra-doc links, the ability to link to items in docs by name

body:
Given the following code:
```rust
//! [nod@x]
//! [f@foo]
mod x {}

fn foo() {}
macro_rules! foo {
  () => {}
}
```

The current output is:

```
warning: unknown disambiguator `nod`
 --> unknown-disambiguator.rs:1:6
  |
1 | //! [nod@x]
  |      ^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(rustdoc::broken_intra_doc_links)]` on by default

warning: unknown disambiguator `f`
 --> unknown-disambiguator.rs:2:6
  |
2 | //! [f@foo]
  |      ^
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
warning: unknown disambiguator `nod`
 --> unknown-disambiguator.rs:1:6
  |
1 | //! [nod@x]
  |      ^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(rustdoc::broken_intra_doc_links)]` on by default
  = help: remove the disambiguator: `[x]`

warning: unknown disambiguator `f`
 --> unknown-disambiguator.rs:2:6
  |
2 | //! [f@foo]
  |      ^
  = help: link to the function: `[foo()]`
  = help: link to the macro: `[foo!()]`
```

This will be tricky because right now resolving links is intermingled with emitting warnings, there's no way to say "will this link resolve".

cc @lopopolo, #83859
